title: Litterae Consolatoriae; from the author to the dejected place of his nativity, the honourable city of London: emporium of Great Brittain; in some prophetick glances at it's future glory and prosperity; indici[um?] of it's present happiness, from it's upright and judicious Lord Mayor, the right honourable Sir William Turner knight; to whom he wisheth a long and happy life here, and unexpressable glory hereafter.
publisher: Printed for Rowland Reynolds, at the Sun and Bible in Postern-street near Moregate,
